from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
import logging

# Read the data
df = spark.read.parquet("abfss://juror-etl@baubaisadfsastg.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_transformed")

# Coalesce to a single partition
df_single = df.coalesce(1)

# Write as a single file to a different location
#df_single.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("abfss://juror-etl@baubaisadfsastg.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_temp_main")

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
path = "abfss://juror-etl@baubaisadfsastg.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_postgresql"
exists = mssparkutils.fs.exists(path)
print(f"Path exists: {exists}")

import logging  # Ensure logging is imported
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, TimestampType
from pyspark.sql.utils import AnalysisException
import os  # Import os for file system checks

def handle_null_values(df):
    """
    Handle NaN, NaT, and other invalid values in the DataFrame
    Convert them to None (NULL in SQL) to avoid PostgreSQL errors
    """
    from pyspark.sql.functions import col, when, lit

    # Log the initial state
    logging.info(f"Starting null value handling for DataFrame with {df.count()} rows")

    # First, handle timestamp columns which might contain NaT
    timestamp_columns = ['date_selected1', 'date_selected2', 'date_selected3']
    for column in timestamp_columns:
        if column in df.columns:
            # For timestamp columns, explicitly set null values
            df = df.withColumn(
                column,
                when(
                    (col(column).isNull()) |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "NaT") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "nat") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "nan") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "NaN"),
                    lit(None)
                ).otherwise(col(column))
            )
            logging.info(f"Processed timestamp column: {column}")

    # For all other columns, handle NaN and empty strings
    for column in df.columns:  # Use df.columns instead of undefined df_single.columns
        if column not in timestamp_columns:
            # Replace empty strings, "NaN", "nan", etc. with NULL
            df = df.withColumn(
                column,
                when(
                    (col(column).isNull()) |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "nan") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "NaN") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "NULL") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "NAN") |
                    (col(column).cast("string") == "None"),
                    lit(None)
                ).otherwise(col(column))
            )

    logging.info(f"Completed null value handling, DataFrame now has {df.count()} rows")
    return df

# Now to read existing data, clean it, and overwrite it:
storage_account = "baubaisadfsastg"
postgresql_path = f"abfss://juror-etl@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_postgresql"

# Define schema manually in case the directory is empty or schema cannot be inferred
schema = StructType([
    StructField("date_selected1", TimestampType(), True),
    StructField("date_selected2", TimestampType(), True),
    StructField("date_selected3", TimestampType(), True),
    StructField("other_column", StringType(), True)  # Add other fields as needed
])

# Read the existing data
try:
    print(f"Checking if path exists and contains files: {postgresql_path}")
    
    # Check if the directory exists and contains files
    hadoop_path = spark._jvm.org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path(postgresql_path)
    fs = spark._jvm.org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.get(spark._jsc.hadoopConfiguration())
    
    if not fs.exists(hadoop_path):
        raise Exception(f"The specified path does not exist: {postgresql_path}")
    
    # Check if the directory contains files
    file_status = fs.listStatus(hadoop_path)
    if not file_status or len(file_status) == 0:
        raise Exception(f"The directory exists but contains no files: {postgresql_path}")

    # Read the Parquet files
    existing_data = spark.read.schema(schema).parquet(postgresql_path)
    print(f"Read {existing_data.count()} records from {postgresql_path}")

    # Apply the null value handler
    cleaned_data = handle_null_values(existing_data)

    # Overwrite the existing data
    print(f"Writing cleaned data back to {postgresql_path}")
    cleaned_data.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(postgresql_path)

    print(f"Successfully overwrote data at {postgresql_path}")
except AnalysisException as e:
    print(f"Error reading data: {e}")
    print("The directory might be empty or inaccessible.")
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error processing data: {str(e)}")
    import traceback
    print(traceback.format_exc())

from pyspark.sql.functions import count

final_count = df.groupBy('creation_date','rec_num') \
    .agg(count('rec_num')) \
    .orderBy('creation_date')

display(final_count)
